Class Review

java.lang.Object
application.Review
public class Review extends Object
Represents a review for an answer in the question and answer system. This class stores information about the review content, the reviewer, the answer being reviewed, and tracks helpful/not helpful votes.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Application Team

  • Constructor Details

    • Review

      public Review(String reviewBody, String reviewedBy, int answerID)
      Constructs a new Review object with the specified details. Initializes the helpful and not helpful counts to zero.
      Parameters:
      reviewBody - The text content of the review
      reviewedBy - The username of the user who wrote the review
      answerID - The ID of the answer being reviewed

    • Review

      public Review(String reviewBody, String reviewedBy, int answerID, int helpfulCount, int notHelpfulCount)
      Constructs a new Review object with the specified details including initial helpful and not helpful vote counts.
      Parameters:
      reviewBody - The text content of the review
      reviewedBy - The username of the user who wrote the review
      answerID - The ID of the answer being reviewed
      helpfulCount - Number of helpful votes to initialize with
      notHelpfulCount - Number of not helpful votes to initialize with

      public String getReviewBody()
      Returns the text content of this review.
      Returns:
      The review's text content

    • getReviewedBy

      public String getReviewedBy()
      Returns the username of the person who wrote this review.

      Returns the ID of the answer being reviewed.
      Returns:

      The number of helpful votes

    • getNotHelpfulCount

      public int getNotHelpfulCount()
      Returns the current count of not helpful votes for this review.
      Returns:
      The number of not helpful votes

      Parameters:
      helpfulCount - The new helpful votes count

    • setNotHelpfulCount

      public void setNotHelpfulCount(int notHelpfulCount)
      Updates the count of not helpful votes for this review.
      Parameters:

    • incrementHelpful

      public void incrementHelpful()
      Increments the helpful votes count by one.

    • incremenetNotHelpful

      public void incremenetNotHelpful()
      Increments the not helpful votes count by one. Note: Method name contains a typo in the original code.

    • getReviewScore

      public int getReviewScore()
      Calculates a score for the review based on the ratio of helpful votes to total votes.
      Returns:
      An integer score from 0-100 representing the percentage of helpful votes, or 0 if there are no votes
